body: Thank you @j143. LGTM. Would you like to add further tests or can I merge this?

If we don't need to worry about testing operation result through `MLContext`, 'cause the different operations are already tested normally and compared with `https://github.com/apache/systemml/blob/master/src/test/scripts/functions/codegen/Algorithm_LinregCG.R#L23`, we can go for merging. 

With the consequent algorithms I will be improving myself on how exactly the `mlcontext` functions. And if there is no comparison scripts, I'll try to add comparison `R` scripts.

Thanks.

I run the scenario with latest code and changes from this PR, I had issue earlier and its working fine.

LGTM

cc @mboehm7 @deroneriksson 
I believe the test failed with little matrix, 'cause of the high sparsity.

Hi Krishna, it's nice. Do you want to give a simple try over a real dataset such as [
Glass Identification Data Set](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/glass/glass.data) or [RandData](https://github.com/apache/systemml/blob/5decbe64b362e29901f15231c672c7b7816ed55a/scripts/datagen/genRandData4PCA.dml) to test.(?). At present, we doesn't seem to have a default script to test this.

@j143 I created an Apache Infrastructure to see if SystemML contributors can have access to the Start Progress/Stop Progress buttons. See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-15023

With this change, the expected results were observed for both toNumPy() and toPandas():

result.toNumPy()
SystemML Statistics:
Total execution time:  0.017 sec.
Number of executed Spark inst: 2.

array([[-60.],
       [-60.],
       [-60.]])

This is a quick work-around but I'm open to suggestions for better way or location to ensure non-blank script string.
cc @niketanpansare @asurve

  • org.apache.sysml.test.integration.functions.parfor.ParForBlockwiseDataPartitioningTest.testParForColBlockPartitioningRemoteLocalSparseNegative

Note this change also resolved similar "Script string is blank" exception test failures for test_matrix_agg_fn.py and test_matrix_binary_op.py under src/main/python/tests.  The single test failure reported for corresponding pull request build is not applicable.

@krishnakalyan3 - this is good work.
Here are a couple of things I'd suggest. 

- Compare results from this version to scikit or some other package you **trust** to some reasonable degree of accuracy. Not being very knowledgable in the domain, I'll leave it to you to decide what that is. Make sure to test against real and artificial data.
- Compare results from this version to the previous version of `PCA.dml`. For results and performance. Single node and spark/hybrid_spark mode.
- Write automated tests for this script. That could mean something that looks like PR #647 or something else.
@j143 Yes, in the future, please remove unnecessary imports. I'll go ahead and remove them and merge. Thank you!
@nakul02 thanks for the feedback.

@deroneriksson - It spits out a warning when `mvn clean package -Pdistribution` is run on a windows or linux machine about trying to include a dependency again. Is this okay to have around?
Or is there a more elegant solution?

@nakul02 Usually it is good to avoid maven warnings if possible (although not always necessary). Perhaps you can work with @gweidner (who uses SystemML with Windows) to see if the warning can be removed?

Sample error message observed before updates:
`ValueError: Cannot run multiple SparkContexts at once; existing SparkContext(app=test_mllearn_df.py, master=local[*]) created by getOrCreate at /home/ambari-qa/systemml/src/main/python/tests/../systemml/mlcontext.py:42`

@niketanpansare - the optimization flags look good.
The read/write locks may not be needed. 

Read/write locks are applied only to not evict a particular block because it will be used in the *current* operation. Whether it is a read or a write is irrelevant.
There should never be any sort of lock (read/write) after the operation is over. If there is, then we aren't updating our data structures.

If it is for adding correctness checks, you could keep them, though, what we have already is sort of simpler.

Also, I don't like the way eviction policy logic is implemented. In a uncalled for need for brevity, it has become complex.
If we plan on sticking with eviction policy set to LRU, we can just use [LRUCacheMap](https://github.com/apache/systemml/blob/master/src/main/java/org/apache/sysml/utils/LRUCacheMap.java) as the type for `allocatedObjects` and get rid of redundant stuff like timestamp.
If we do decide to go to a another scheme, we can use another data structure later.

@nakul02 I have removed ALLOW_GPU_LAZY_CUDA_FREE logic from OptimizerUtils. We can revisit the issue with lazy cuda free in a separate PR. I would recommend keeping read/write locks as it eliminates future bugs. I am in favor of simplifying the eviction policy, but we can do that in a separate PR as well.

Hi @krishnakalyan3 @nakul02 @j143,

In my opinion, this PR focuses on functionalizing PCA ([SYSTEMML-493](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYSTEMML-493)), and we should really stay focused on that task, which is functionalizing the existing algorithm. I believe it can be validated using existing code in the project (it appears that it can be validated with runAllDimensionReduction.sh, which generates PCA data and then runs PCA.dml on that data). So perhaps Krishna can simply validate that the new script runs with runAllDimensionReduction.sh? If the functionalized PCA script runs like the non-functionalized PCA script, then it can be merged.

Additional tasks such as automated testing could be performed as additional PRs. For example, an automated MLContext PCA test JIRA could be created under [SYSTEMML-1645](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYSTEMML-1645). The SystemML project as a whole could definitey use improved algorithm testing, but I think issues like that should be handled in separate PRs.

Perhaps a comment could be added to the staging/PCA.dml file indicating that this script is a functionalized version of the original PCA.dml script?

cc @dusenberrymw
